thread.title: Kellie Maloney's heartbreak as First Dates episode canned when man discovered she was a 'celebrity trans'
thread.title_full: Kellie Maloney's heartbreak as First Dates episode canned when man discovered she was a 'celebrity trans'

author: Vicki Newman
title: Kellie Maloney's heartbreak as First Dates episode canned when man discovered she was a 'celebrity trans'
text:
Kellie Maloney's heartbreak as First Dates episode canned when man discovered she was a 'celebrity trans' The trans star revealed the sad reason her episode will never air on Lorraine Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Kellie Maloney's First Dates episode will never be aired Share this video Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
Boxing promoter Kellie Maloney has revealed the sad reason we'll NEVER see her episode of First Dates. 
The trans star chatted to Christine Bleakley on Thursday morning's Lorraine about her experience filming the hit Channel 4 dating show. 
Despite having a wonderful date, Kellie said that we'll never see her on the show, because the man she had dinner with won't let us. 
She told Christine that her date told producers they couldn't air the show after he found out that Kellie used to be a man. Read More Kellie Maloney shows off new fresh-faced look as she prepares to reinvent herself as a pub landlady She spoke about filming the dating show (Photo: ITV) 
The star said: "That never got off the ground. I went out for dinner to the restaurant, it was really nice and everything was going well. 
"And I was surprised to hear that the gentleman was very upset to hear I was a celebrity trans and he didn't want the footage shown. No one will ever see it. 
"And no one ever saw me, I'm the perfect date if you're looking for someone." 
Kellie also opened up to Christine about her struggles with loneliness since transitioning. 
She said: "During [my transitiion] was the worst period, there were times I never came out the house, it was very frightening. She had a nice time on her date (Photo: ITV) But he said it couldn't be aired after finding out Kellie is trans (Photo: ITV) 
"I lived my life on the internet, I was scared I'd lose my family, I was isolated from the world." 
Kellie now has a support group which helps her through the tough times and is doing well despite at one point being "frightened of every day contact". 
She added: "I was frightened of being discovered, I did in the end unfortunately and that's helped me out in the end and got me over my loneliness." Read More Kellie also opened up about feeling lonely (Photo: ITV) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
